body:
The MXP is absolutely stunning. It puts a customer in control. Carrier unlocked, pure Google Android experience without the annoying bloatware, manufacturer, and carrier  apps. Non-intrusive Motorola features which are extremely helpful but your choice to turn on or off, expandable storage up to 128GB via SDcard, ergonomic design built solid, large vibrant display, front facing stereo speakers with awesome sound quality, and a 21 megapixel camera, if people think it falls short, its only the software and LCD viewing display. Put the picture on a high density 1080p LED display, you'll understand. Pixels matter. Battery life is what it is, not the best but not the worst. Depending on how your going to use the device, it Will always be a matter of contention.
Athough like many have stated, amoled would arguably have been a better choice. Personally, I would liked to have seen the power and volume buttons reversed, but hey, not a deal breaker, you quickly adapt. For the tech savvy, you even have the support by Motorola to unlock the bootloader, although you loose your warranty and rightly so for good reason.
This Moto X Pure is fantastic in so many respects that any shortcomings are far outweighed by its benefits. You can't go wrong!
Great phone!!

What can I say this is the second smartphone that I have ever owned the first was a Samsung S3 which I enjoyed. This time decided to get an unlocked phone and not have all the extra stuff that comes with bought phone from provider or what the whole world flocks to. Must say I really enjoy having a straight up Android phone, this phone is solid and comes with some nice features. Will enjoy exploring all the functions that it has to offer. Plus you can't beat the price!
Best Android Phone to Date!

PSA this phone is very PICKY with third party quick charge 2.0 fast chargers, almost 80% don't work as in it doesn't even charge. BEWARE

Hate how they didn't give us the option to get a smaller version, not everyone wants phablets. But that's not even what I don't like about this phone. First of all the size wasn't that bad, it's about the same size as a G4 and size is decent. But i'd rather have a bit smaller and shorter phone. While the specs seem great about this phone, don't be fooled by reviews online. The front facing speakers were great, def better than the mono speakers most phones come with. Boom speakers from htc are still better but these ones were LOUD but the quality isn't that great but it's still better than mono speakers. Camera is not as good as samsung or lg and a bunch of others but it's def GOOD enough, but great. Overall I liked the camera and especially the Moto Skin, 2nd BEST to stock android. Ok so what I hate is the Quad HD display, quad hd is such a waste, the naked eye can't even tell. So the battery turned out being BELOW AVERAGE....even my htc M8 even lasted just as long and that's 2 years old. What killed this device is the WASTEFUL QUAD HD DISPLAY and the BATTERY and also the size for some people.
This is a great phone! It even works on Verizon's net work too!!!!!
As close to having a nexus phone that you can get while still having an MicroSD slot. And free of carrier bloatware.

I'm upgrading from a Lumia 1020 phone that barely had a year of use after I left the Galaxy S4 Mini, AKA the worst Galaxy phone ever. Great phone as well, (best camera of any phone, hands down, no contest with this nor iPhone 6s/Galaxy 6) but Windows Phone was poorly implemented, no SD slot and poor battery performance. This phone is proving to be much more reliable.

The build quality of the phone is outstanding, though the corners can be a bit troublesome to some people, and the huge screen can take a bit getting used to. I have the bamboo back, which I thought was going to be annoying or uncomfortable, but the wood is actually reasonably soft and comfy. To be honest, however, I would have preferred the leather or plastic backs, but the phone is so great that they were out of stock at the time and I chose to secure the phone first.

From opening the box, the phone proves to be a great experience. The inside of the box is very cozy, holding the phone in one slot, and a protective case (though you'd do better buying a rugged case from Amazon instead), power cable, and such in the other. The phone comes with a key thing to open the SIM card/SD card combo slot (it uses a nano SIM card by the way, so if you're upgrading from a micro SIM card phone like the aforementioned Lumia you need a new SIM), which works great. The SIM and SD are a bit meh to insert, but not difficult.

The phone immediately picks up your SIM card and sets up/works great and immediately functions. Absolutely no bloatware or cheap/carrier-specific apps, except for one or two Motorola apps which actually work great for your needs. The specs and screen are both amazing too: the videos look outstanding (Netflix at least. Youtube is really meh) and the colors are accurately reflected. What I love about the phone is the super loud speakers! They don't compromise sound quality over size and the quality is very clear too.

My only gripe with the phone is with Motorola's stock camera app. For 4K videos and the like, it works great. For photos, it's awful. Just awful. Absolutely little to no control over focus, manual controls, and the like. And the macro/focusing interface is among the worst. However, the workaround is really simple: find a different, better camera app. I've tried quite a few, but so far Pixlr is the most consistent, delivering outstanding lighting and image quality and great use of the flash. By the way, unlike most phones, the selfie camera has a flash, so yay I guess?

To summarize, super cool phone and actually preferrable in many regards over Galaxys and iPhones. Just get a different camera app.

So far so good.

I am coming from the typical Verizon phone line, so to finally have a near-stock phone is quite amazing.  The biggest change has been the speed thanks in part to being able to remove any of the software that I want.  I was also very happy that when I took it to Verizon to be activated that my monthly bill went down, and now I am on a month-to-month plan.
its moto/nexus or nothing.. best android phone. period
One of the best phones I have owned, and yet affortable. Fast and no bloat-wear. I simply love the bamboo backing. Thanks Moto

I've been using cell phones since 1993, have gone through many of them. This is the best yet. You absolutely do not need to spend more than this on a phone, if you do, you're wasting your money and buying for status only. I laugh at the $700.00 HTC 10, you'd have to be out of your mind to spend that much on a phone that does nothing more than the Moto X Pure Edition.

I was sooooo disappointed in the performance and look of the phone. Every review that I read, BRAGGED about the picture quality, sharp colors. I was like, "What phone are they talking about?" Maybe marketers for phone. Anyway, the picture quality was poor. The phone froze on me many times as I set it up.  The icons were bland and hard to find. Very disappointed. Sending back for refund. Glad zi hung onto my Samsung S5.

I owned each of the last few Motorola iterations and after returning the Moto X Pure, I will go over a few topics.  For now, I decided to stick with my Nexus 6 as my daily phone and I have a Moto X 2014 (paid $195 unlocked Best Buy Clearance and bought as a backup). Here are a few topics I found important and I'll explain why I am going to return the Moto X Pure. I also paid $299 during the Motorola sale period. I do think the phone is worth that price for sure if you have an older phone but not as an upgrade over the Nexus 6 or even the Moto X 2014 for that matter.

1) Build Quality.  I don't know exactly what it is, but the Moto X Pure felt more cheaply built than either my Nexus 6 or my Moto X 2014.  It just didn't seem as tightly put together, the bamboo back felt more flimsy than on my bamboo Moto X 2014 and the metal frame felt cheaper too.  The kicker for me was the bamboo was miscut and there was a gap between the finger/camera metal section and the back cover itself.  It seems that the build quality took a hit with the Moto X Pure. If I were to purchase again, I think I would opt for the silicon back. Of the three, maybe because of the smaller size the Moto X 2014 seems the more premium model.

2) Camera - Moto X Pure wins this hands down especially in lower light.  Also the details in photos was much sharper and the phone wasn't searching as much.  It was one of the reasons I wanted to give the Moto X a shot, but it wasn't as big of an improvement as I thought it might be.

3) Screen LCD vs Amoled - Initially, I found myself gravitating more towards the LCD panel.  Having been a previous iPhone user (I prefer stock android) the Moto X Pure did remind me of the iPhone screen quite a bit, but in bright light I didn't notice a huge upgrade from the Nexus 6, which surprised me.  In the evening, when I am reading I do prefer the amoled screen because it does not stay as bright, so I opted to keep my Nexus 6. I think this is a personal preference however.

4) Battery Life - Nexus 6 hands down. I lost about 12-15% more battery running the exact same youtube video on the Moto X Pure than I did on the Nexus 6.  Both were also running Marshmallow. The battery on the Moto X Pure also ran hotter than both the Nexus 6 and the Moto X 2014

5) Feel in Hand - Moto Dimple - I thought this would be an area that the Moto X Pure would easily win, but Motorola decided to LOWER the dimple and make it smaller.  It DOES NOT WORK nearly as well as the dimple on my Moto X 2014 or my Nexus 6.  The lower placement on the dimple of the Moto X Pure makes the phone feel top heavy. It just doesn't feel as natural as the other two.  I have large hands and the Moto X Pure felt thinner than my Nexus 6 of course, but the Nexus 6 felt more comfortable for me because of the higher dimple placement, so I felt like I have more control over the phone. The Pure edition placement does not work for me. I also like the separation between the camera and the dimple.  On the Moto X Pure they are bridged, which made it easier to tell them apart, but again the dimple is too low.

6) Bluetooth Connectivity - Okay the Moto X 2014 wins this one hands down. In fact, I've taken my Moto X 2014 out to exercise quite a bit more lately because it is smaller thus easier to stick in my pocket and forget about it, but it also NEVER cuts out when I have my LG Bluetooth headset on.  I thought my Nexus 6 was bad, but the Moto X Pure cut out constantly. It was the worse of the three.  Not sure what that's all about, but it was horrible.

7) Concluding thoughts - I tried to cover things that were not in Chris W.'s review so hopefully this helps. Now, is the Pure Edition worth the upgrade from the Nexus 6 or Moto X 2014 - personally at $299 it might be from the Moto X 2014, but not from the Nexus 6.  If you have something older it is a good buy, but I would probably opt to pay a bit more for the Nexus 6P (currently $425). At $299 (currently) for both the Moto Pure and the Nexus 5X I would go for the Pure for sure as well.

It does everything I want and then some. The camera is awesome. I switched from iPhone. This phone is way better. I've always been the type to outright buy my phone's because i hate the idea of a contract for cellular service. I paid for my iPhone in full and the glass broke for the last time and I was unwilling to replace it so I began looking for other options. I'm convinced iPhone is rigged to keep people buying screens and after my screen was replaced the first time it never responded as quick and froze offen. Surely someone has a phone comparable or better than iPhone without paying $700-$800. I found this phone during my research. I loved the look and I wanted to know more. I read rave reviews. I found it on Amazon and decided to buy it. The Ask Google feature is much better than siri. Ask goggle answers my questions 99.9% of the time. Siri was more like 60% and siri would have me laughing sometimes because she was no where near right. I wished I would've made this switch a long time ago!
Amazing so far, a great cellphone!
despite some drawbacks and weaknesses, moto x still definitely is the best bang for the buck phone so far
Excellent phone. Though, when it gets hot, the touch screen becomes a little dysfunctional.

I was shocked when I got this phone due to the size of the screen. After a day of using it, I took a look at my old phone and just couldn't believe how I could be reading from that tiny little screen, so you can get used to it easily.
One thing that matters to me on a phone is the camera: I am not a pro, in fact I do not take many pictures, simply because I like "enjoying the moment", but from time to time, while on travel, I want to take a few pictures, and I want them to look good without having to carry a brick like camera. Now, this phone has one of the best cameras I have ever had. Unfortunately, to be honest, iPhone 6 is better on this (my dad owns one and the pics are astounding) but, hey, this is android and half the price after all!
If you are selfie lover (which I am not), you will love the 5 MP front facing camera with flash, for those special moments at the disco.
From a software perspective, Motorola gesture features are awesome. However, do not expect the "OK Google" to work: it seems like Google is having some trouble with that at the moment.
It comes with pure Android, latest version. No added look and feels or stupid useless apps like on other brands.
Power charger...how I love this. I forget to charge my devices, period. With this charger, I can get to 25% in about 9 minutes.
A final note on the design: feels great to touch and looks fancy. Although, it might feel too big for your pockets and will catch curious eyes when checking emails or texts, just make sure you are not reading anything private in public.
On the downside, I must admit I was disappointed with what Motorola put in the box: just the power charger and instructions. No USB cable, no headphones (big, big, HUGE MISTAKE). It comes with a bumper case, though (nice touch, but I'd rather have my headphones, what I am supposed to do? buy new ones?! again HUGE MISTAKE).
Overall, I would recommend getting this phone. Great price-quality relationship.
Great screen and battery life.

I was skeptical about this phone and still wasn't sure the first two days but I have to say I really like it. Motorola makes the best workhorse phones I've ever used so I took a chance.... and I'm not disappointed! One thing that wasn't in any of the reviews is the dedicated hotspot icon in the settings pulldown. Usually I need to download an app so I wasn't looking for it. It handling everything I throw at it with out any glitches. I just happened to find it by accident. Shipped with 60% battery life and after a fast Micro SD and Sim card insert, it was up and ready in a matter of minutes, 7 to be exact! Bigger than I thought it would be but just a little taller than my Droid MAXX so I quickly got use to it.

Been using this phone for about three weeks now, and it's been Great! Love the motion features to launch flash light and the camera. The bamboo back definitely makes this phone stands out from those metal and plastic covers. Although I have to get a cover to protect it from scratch (trust me you won't want to see a scratch on such a nice bamboo cover) you can still the beautiful bamboo back from the clear case I put on. If you like a pure Android experience and premium design, this is the phone to go with!
Excellent phone. A little big, but works great with good battery life.

I've waited for years for a phone like this: works with any carrier, straight Android OS with no manufacturer specific interface to slow the phone down, no bloatware, great cameras, great screen, light-weight, with a long lasting battery that charges quickly.

Shoots 4K video and 21MP still photos with crisp, bright images. The call quality is superb. Very fast with no lag due to a fast processor, no manufacturer's interface and no bloatware.

I have Verizon as my carrier with unlimited data so the built-in tethering and 2.4G/5G Wi-Fi hot spot works fantastic for sharing data with laptops, tablets, etc. while traveling or enjoying the outdoors.

Activating on Verizon was relatively painless, called 611 from another phone and provided the IMEI number and it was operational in 2-3 minutes. FYI, very few if any of the Verizon stores (at least in my area) are corporate owned so the employees are sometimes less than enthusiastic and sometimes lack the knowledge for providing service for products they don't sell.

I purchased mine directly from Motorola before they were available from Amazon so I was able to get the custom accent color, custom engraving and custom boot message. My phone was built in Shenzhen, China on a Thursday and FedEx delivered it on the next Monday.

Don't hesitate to buy this phone
Received the moto x pure edition to day, in perfect condition. Very please with the phone . very pleased with amazon and the service. What more can I say. Good job!
Fantastic phone. No bloat and pretty much everything can be disabled. My only gripe is that I cannot disable the Google App. Otherwise its perfect.

My opinion may change over time but as of today May 9, 2016, I absolutely love this phone.  There are some small differences that enhance the user-friendliness on my part as well as improve things that irked me previously.  Otherwise it is mostly the same as my original Moto X which I am upgrading from.  I'm with Sprint so I didn't get the second generation and somehow I managed to miss another iteration of the Moto X at some point???  Anywho, after eyeing this for months I finally bought it from the Amazon Warehouse...a beautiful white and bamboo 32-GB Moto X Pure.  It was supposedly used but there is no indication of that other than the plastic covering not being over the screen and the paperwork did not have the SIMs card opener---no big deal as I still had the one from my original Moto X.

Thanks to Motorola Migrate, setup was a breeze.  What wasn't a breeze were the idiot Sprint store men who couldn't seem to figure out how to activate my phone.  They finally figured out the right SIMs card to use but not how to make my phone work properly with it.  After wasting a good hour and a half of my time, I finally went to Best Buy where the nice young woman had me going in twenty minutes.  When I asked what she thought their problem was she just shrugged and said she updated the PRL and had no issues getting it on the Sprint network.

That finally aside, I could finally see what it truly had to offer, starting with the camera.  The Iphone's camera is light-years better but that's to be expected with the price point.  Compared to the original Moto X, I am beyond satisfied.  The native camera app still doesn't work as well for me quality-wise so I downloaded a third-party camera and I am presently happy with it.  Other than the camera, that's arguably the only significant difference I see between this and the Iphone.  My husband has the Iphone 6 Plus and when we simultaneously loaded pages and apps, they opened at the same rate of speed (super fast) with no lag.  Even with everything I originally had on my original Moto X that had it filled to the brim at 16 gigs, it is still going strong.  I ordered a 64 GB micro SD to expand the memory just in case but question whether I would need it now.

I am not an electronics guru.  I am simply a person that knows what I like and tends to stick with it.  I've had the original Moto X for 3 years.  I dropped my custom Moto one too many times September 2015 so a new phone was in order.  So I had to hunt down another original Moto X (which I ironically got from Best Buy for $150) which I encased in a sturdy case and kept drop free until now and will pass it on to my daughter.  I couldn't imagine getting another type of phone...Motorola made a believer out of me.  Does this phone have too many additional bells and whistles over the original?  No, not in my opinion but it is still worth it with all of the additional features and improvements and the price point can't be beat.  I love the bigger size...I thought it would be unwieldy but actually it works better for me overall.  The battery...it does charge faster with the turbo charger and lasts all day before I find I need a charge.  I do find that the charge lasts through the night without being plugged which my poor little Moto X original could not boast so that alone is an A+++ in my book.

I apologize if this isn't a very techy review, but like I said, I like what I like and that's that.  My opinion may change depending on whether I run into any issues or not.  I'll update as necessary.
Love it, nice phone

This is one heck of a good smartphone!  Currently the phone is running Android 5.1.1, and it's buttery smooth with no performance hiccups whatsoever.  We're about a week or two from getting the Android Marshmallow 6.0 update, which should make the phone perform even better, especially excited about the new battery saving features( DOZE). The battery life on 5.1.1 has actually been really good, as I have no problem getting through a whole day (7am to 10pm) on a full charge. The Turbo charger is also fantastic, I never worry about having to charge the phone overnight anymore. The biggest hold-up I had buying this phone was the size, the thing is big. Surprisingly enough I have gotten use to the size and now prefer the larger size advantages to any disadvantages I may have worried about before. This could probably be considered the best Android smartphone of the year regardless of price if it included a fingerprint sensor, but at $400 with a sd card option, and some waterproofing I'm not sure this can be topped. The only other phones I would have considered would be the Galaxy S5, which is hampered by its truly awful Touchwiz software, and $800+ price point (Samsung could rule the Android world if the boneheads would get rid of Touchwiz and run stock Android, they're hardware kicks ass), and the new Nexus 6P, which looks like an awesome phone, but is $100 more than the Moto X. I usually only keep phones for 1 year and in this case the $400 Moto X cannot be beat!
My first device with 16 gb of internal memory. Not enough for me

Seems like a software problem since I might restart the phone and then they will work again but after a couple of restarts and factory resets I didn't get to solve the issue thoroughly.
Stick to a nexus phone, don't event waste your time...

After the unexpected nightmare hassle my service provider deemed necessary for connecting the Moto X Pure to my account, I can cheerfully report only glowing compliments for the build quality and user experience with this device. Along the way I encountered multiple reps from my provider who insisted this phone wouldn't work. They were flat out wrong and speeds actually rival my home broadband. Maybe that says more about the oppression of Time Warner than anything else...

MOTO X PURE EXCEEDED ALL EXPECTATIONS
The screen will shatter just like any other phone...had the phone about 2 months and already had to replace the screen!!! (When it shatters it comes out in little shards)

I'm a Verizon user.  I started with a Droid Ultra, then I moved to a Moto X 1st Generation.  I just got my Moto X Pure delivered today.  I have the SAME SIM CARD as I had originally with the Droid Ultra.  This is the third phone for the original SIM card.  Popped it in my Moto X Pure, set up the device, started making phone calls with no required call to Verizon, AUTOMATICALLY ACTIVATED.  Easiest thing ever.  Moving from Verizon to Verizon with the same SIM card couldn't have been easier.  So, you can be a Verizon customer and have a great activation experience.  I'll update the review later with more details, but NICE BIG SCREEN.  Slightly larger than my wife's iPhone 6+.  More to come........

Great phone, great price. Work fast, open every file. Navigates on 4G without issues. The battery is long lasting and it really goes from 6% to 60% un 15 min. The display does compite with the iohone retina display. The andoid on this phone simply works great. The cameras take very nice picture even when is a night picture.

Great Phone! Great value! Great display! The best speakers on any phone. Even better than HTC BoomSound speakers! The phone does get hot when you charge it and the battery is bad, but it charges stupid fast! Like less than an hour you can 100% if your phone was at 15-20. Overall a great phone for entertainment but its not perfect... But NO phone really is.
Purchased for my little sister.  It's quick, has great build quality, and has a great camera (for once).  Motorola stepped up their game for this one.

Maybe you'll get lucky, maybe you won't, the question is are you willing to roll the dice...
Personally, I thought this was going to be a great phone. It started out that way and lasted about 2 months. Then the screen went wacky, vertical lines, very light... After doing some online research it looks like they may have some quality issues with this phone, I can certainly attest to that.
So I call support and the nightmare begins...
Here's the summary of my [really bad word here] experience with support.
I paid $25 to have a working phone sent to me, after which I'm supposed to send my original broken phone back.
Since, I've been sent 3 REFURB replacement phones, ALL NON-WORKING, all have been returned back to Motorola
I'VE BEEN CHARGED OVER $500!!!, which they INSIST cannot be reversed until after they receive my original non-working phone I paid for in full almost 5 months ago now, and I still don't have a working replacement phone. (They tell me one's on the way... They also told me I would not be billed the $500, several times in fact)
This began in January, it's now mid march. Incompetence reigns at Motorola! One cannot assume support staff understands what you say if you're speaking english. After being treated this way, I will do everything I can to NEVER work with Motorola again! I wish I could send this message up the ranks to the person in charge of overseeing support. Either they don't know what's going on, they're completely incompetent, or they just don't care about their customers.
Looks and working real good very satisfied

This is a very nice phone. I like it a fair amount better than my Xperia Z2. In terms of performance, the difference is negligible between the two. This device does have a better screen that's higher resolution and makes Google Cardboard content look a lot better but the Snapdragon 808 is more side-grade rather than upgrade to Snapdragon 801/805 devices. With Marshmallow and Doze, when the phone is stationary, standby time is amazing. There's barely any discharge over night. Also the quick charger is very fast. When moving around a lot during the day, the battery life is mediocre especially compared to Sony phones. It is still good enough for me though. I use my micro-sd as adopted storage and I often forget that I have since the read speeds appear sufficient enough for me not to notice. It's a very nice phone. This will keep me satisfied for a long time.

I love this phone just on its own merits, but when I compare it to my Galaxy S5, it rocks the house.  After my 2nd Galaxy went belly up after a year I decided it was time to go back to Motorola.  I ordered mine from Motorola.com because I wanted the champagne frame and if I was going to pay the same price as here - I wanted the bambo back engraved. Also for $5 they will send you a SIM card specifically for your carrier - in my case Verizon.  First thing I noticed was how heavy it was in my hand. It feels substantial. The display is amazing - even text is so much clearer than my GS5.  I have only had the phone 4 days so I haven't gotten to play w/ the camera as much as I would like - but I Love Love Love that you shake the phone and the camera opens.  No more having to unlock the phone and open the camera and OOPS - too late.  I also am blown away (again) by the voice response "Google Now".  I don't mean to bash Samsung but 50% of the time when I asked it a question it said, "I will do a Google search for......"  Thanks - I could have done that myself.  I have been having trouble syncing my Outlook calendar w/ my Google calendar and so tonight I ask the Pure - and I'll be damned if it didn't tell me, step by step how to do it.  And it worked.  Amazing.  I love the Daydream Clock display also: It just softly lights up every so often and shows the time and any new messages etc.  Perfect for nighttime.

Setting up the phone was a dream.  I installed the Moto Move application (not the right name - I don't remember now) on my old phone, touched the backs of the phones together and it 'sucked' all the data, contacts, texts, photos, music off my old phone onto the Pure.  Easy Breezy.  I do not back up my texts so I've never been able to bring them over to my next phone.  I was jazzed.  Activating the phone was a bit more challenging - but I think that was User Error. I didn't think to turn the old phone off.....so the new one wouldn't activate.  I ended up calling Verizon (who, of course, gave me the song and dance that because it was an Unlocked phone (read: I didn't but the phone from them) it might not be able to be activated. (yeah right).  Of course as soon as I shut the old phone off, it activated immediately.  My fault, not the phone's.

I also LOVE not having all the Verizon bloatware on the phone.  I ordered the 32G phone and added a 32G card.  I have NEVER had this much empty storage space on a phone.  I can't believe it.  I also love that the speakers are on the front of the phone. Who was the idiot that decide to put the speakers on the back of a phone in the first place?  Really?

The Turbo charge is really nice but not a big deal to me as I work from home...so I always have a charger available. However the battery life is almost twice that of my GS5.  I would charge that phone at night and then always have to charge it again about 1pm or so.  The Pure I usually only have to charge once a day.

The longer I have this phone the more I discover things to love.

I personally love this phone but it has its flaws but let's start with the pro's
Pro's Feels great in hand,looks amazing, good camera not the best but still very nice,great user experience I use moto voice and moto actions and display every day there so useful,the speakers are amazing I love them,the quick charging is very useful,It actually games very well.
Con,s The biggest one is battery life which sucks but quick charging does help alot,the phone gets hot while Gaming or YouTube but not to bad,moto voice isn't always reliable u have to really yell for it to hear you,and moto actions aren't always reliable.
Overall I say it is a great device that feels premium looks premium and runs great I feel the pro's out way the cons in every aspect!

Worst phone ever seen, works fine for few months. Then it gives complaints like charging problem, battery gets drained quickly.only the camera is worth the cost. It's my personal opinion go for samsung galaxy S5.
It's quite big and heavier than any other motos i had but it'amazing, the design is beautiful and the camera súper!

The verify first smartphone that I got was the original Moto X. The thing was rock solid. I dropped it countless times, and still the phone never skipped a beat or the screen crack. Motorola was known to have some of the best radios then, and they do now. So after trying a Samsung phone for a few years (Galaxy S3), this phone came out and seemed like a huge bargain for the specs vs the price. Add in the fact that it can be used on ANY US carrier, and there was no question that I wanted the phone.

I was first hesitant about the size, but let me tell you know, the added screen real estate is great for playing games and reading text. The large battery keeps the phoned powered for 1 1/2 - 2 days with around 5 hours of screen time. I have no doubt that I'll be keeping this phone until it dies on me, which if Motorola's solid builds should me it'll be quite a few years.
Awesome

I have had this phone for 2 months now. I switched to Android for the first time ever from Iphones. I went android for two main reasons: I use google apps as much as any other app and storage. Apple's prices for stroage are the electronic version of blackmail. I loved the fact I can add up to 128 gig of storage through the external sd card. I really want to love this phone, and there are things I love about it, but I would switch back to iphone today, if I could swing the cost of the 128G iphone right now. First what I love: The storage, the screen (size and clarity) and google which really you can get on the iphone. Now for what I can't live with: Having swithced from iphone I have all kinds of trouble with group texts. I have spent untold hours working on getting this resolved. I have tried every fix know to man. I can be getting group texts in a text string from iphone users and all of a sudden they wont come through and then maybe a day or two later I will start getting them again. With kids in sports and the group text being the only form of communication these days, for this reason alone, I would not switch to android if you have an iphone. They will tell you as long as you sign out of I Message before you switch you will be fine. This is not the case. I have found many other people online who have the same issue. The Bluetooth on this phone is intermittent at best. Some days it will sync with the car, other days it won't. Many times it will sync with the car but will be so full of static it is unusable.  I have a usb cable from the car stereo I can attach, and it won't work at all either with moto x pure. My wife and son have new Galaxies and they work with the usb cable in my car as well as the old iphone. I won't let them try the bluetooth because this phone has been so tempermental I don't want to mess with it. Hands free is a law in my state,s o this is another deal breaker. Besides the fact my phone is my source for music in the car. I'm not loving going back to fm radio. Lastly is the camera. I am sorry but the camera stinks. It is absolutely unusable at night and not great during the day. The other day I imported a photo I had taken with my iphone 5s onto the moto x pure and was blown away by how good it looked on this screen. It looks so good because this phone takes such bad pictures. I am not a photographer and do not need to take particularly great pictures, but I use my camera phone for work every day, and this has been dissapointing. I need to be able to share pictures and the iphone was great at reducing the size to make it easier to share lots of pics. If android can do that, I have not been able to figure it out. I downloaded a couple apps to try to accomplish this with poor results.

I have come to the conclusion the reason the iphone costs so much more than the moto x pure is it is so much better. I should have paid double and stuck with iphone. At this point, I am probably just going to go back to my 5s, the only problem with that is the screen seems so small. Like I said in the begining, I really wanted to love this phone so I could stick it to apple and their rediculous prices for the storage we all need these days. Unfortunately that has not worked out.

This is a great phone! It's fast, has a beautiful and bright screen (easy to read in direct Cali sun), and has a bunch of useful Motorola software additions. It's nice that it comes with a bumper (even if the bumper doesn't fit very snuggly, it does work well to protect the edges).

Also, the camera is fantastic in daylight! Pictures are very sharp and look really good. It can be tough to set focus on a minor part of the picture with the Moto camera app, but mostly it isn't an issue.

This is a great value, I highly recommend!

I was an Android user for the longest time, but then started working in a workplace that used Apple exclusively. I thought that the change may not be that bad, so I went with an iPhone to streamline my workflow with my colleagues. The switch was regrettable, and I began hating my switch to Apple. Apple phones are great...but my personal preference just did not appreciate Apple's OS. With all that being said; I researched, and researched, and forum hopped, and researched some more before deciding to go with this phone. I love pure stock Android, and that's what you get with this phone. It's incredibly smooth, fast, responsive, and sleek. The device feels very sturdy in my hand, and the buttons are just the right amount of firmness, adding a very premium feel to the device. The Moto Display feature has been absolutely amazing, and it really is a feature you have to try before you understand how convenient it really is.  I'm an audiophile and I basically have to be listening to music at all times of the day. The speakers on this phone are NO JOKE. They're clear, loud, and the bass is actually there! Mind you...it's still a phone, so don't expect to shake your house with the bass, but it was awesome for listening to tracks and watching media.  I've had no issues with this phone and really am absolutely happy with everything about it.
This is not a phone: it's a portable TV.

Great device with the exception of screen discoloration (bluish hue spots). Also, microphone is very finicky. I never know when speaker phone or handset use is going to be better for the person on the other end. Frequently I am told I sound "muffled" or "in a wind tunnel". I have been a Moto enthusiast since the original Moto Droid. I've reached out about my issues with no response from Motorola.

Coming from a Samsung Note 3, this phone has a few less sensors (barometric pressure,  accelerometer, etc)  but having said that,  is one of the best phones I have ever owned.  Battery life is excellent.  Charger is very quick with 12v "turbo charging". No bloatware to drain your battery or eat your data.  Get  one. It's way worth it
A gift for my wife and she's very pleased with it. I am too. It looks nice and performs very well.
For what it is, its a great phone. It feels solid to me, coming from the nexus 5, its nothing but an improvement. That sd card slot is a no brainer.
Great phone.

I like the no carrier aspect. Getting it hooked up to Sprint was an issue but other reviewers have put tips on how to get things going. (It works) The phone is powerful enough for me and has a great camera. I like the moto function of twisting to open the camera and use it all the time.

Generally I was not happy with this phone for a couple of reasons.  The initial phone I ordered had extraordinarily poor battery life, and it got HOT to the touch when charging.  Not sure exactly what the issue was, but a bit of research indicated a bad cell in the battery.  Sadly, this wasn't the only issue I had.  Despite this being an "unlocked" phone, I had a devil of a time getting it activated by Sprint.  I'm sure many of you will say "that's a Sprint problem, not a Motorola problem."  Unfortunately, it BECOMES a Motorola problem when it takes several hours of effort to activate the phone.  Finally, I knew this phone would be bigger than my old Moto X, but I didn't fully realize how much bigger til I received it.  This thing is huge, and not really in a good way.  Got a replacement for this one, but ended up returning the replacement as well.  IMO this is not an improvement over my 2013-vintage Moto X...

The phone feels amazing on hand, the design is just beautiful. I did experience some lag at the beggining, when i was using some apps that i had just installed on the phone, but after a moment it starts to run smoothly, I guess it has something to do with marshmallow update. Even though the lcd is not amoled, it looks sharp and perfect, the speakers loud and clear.
Good Phone

This phone could be good except for how fragile it is. The screen broke after a very light fall, and while it just made a single crack, that means the portion of the screen below the crack stopped working.

Then you have to deal with Motorola customer service which is hell. Not one of their representatives is properly trained. Their repair process is confusing as hell, to the point not even the representatives know what happens. Case in point: they promise a replacement in 4 business days. When I call on the 4th day because I do not have it, I then get told it is because they are out of stock. Upset I request a supervisor who then says that this is not a regular phone so it takes 7 to 10 business days but that since they are out of stock, he has heard of cases where people are waiting for up to 5 weeks.
Its a all over good phone. But they should make little improvements in camera clarity.other

Bought the 32gb to save some cash along with the 128gb Sandisk ultra.
Pure edition is the way to go, no carrier crap, able to unlock boot loader and root.  With Greenify, I am getting decent battery life. end of the day i  usually have around 30-52% batter life left.
Typical usage starts at 5:30 Am to 8:00PM.
Push email - exchange ( ~ 30 - 70 emails a day) plus Gmail ( ~ 50-100)  20-40 pictures , less than 60 min talk time.
Google fit, and a dozen other apps tracking and running all day long.
Perfect phone for my needs. Affordable price and the speakers on this phone are among the best I've heard on a smartphone. The camera is great. Fantastic job Motorola!
I love my Moto X!  The quality is amazing and the bamboo wood back is so nice. Already recommend it to my friends who also love it!

One of the better Android OS smartphones I have owned.
Quality of build and screen visibility very good. I have found battery life to be sufficient...... my use is extensive on a daily basis. The ability to add additional SD cards for storage is tremendous.
After replacing my Galaxy which I had for almost 3 years (unheard of), the phone feels a little big but I just need to get use to it. The quality is there and amazing. We are very happy times 3.
Ditched my iPhone for this and couldn't be happier about it.  Top of the line phone, excellent camera, terrific software at half the price.

I love this phone overall but unfortunately, I've had two screens crack within a couple months.  I think the glass is quite cheap and so this expensive phone is down the drain quickly if you crack it.  Make sure to have a very very heavy case protector if you get this phone.
Best phone around, in my opinion.  This is the second one I have bought, this one being for my wife.
Great phone

4G/LTE is not working with Moto X Pure and Motorola customer service is worst!!!

I requested for replacement of the first phone and second device has same issue!!!
However, my SIM is perfectly working with my current iPhone 6 and Others iPhone of my cousin!!!

I tried to contact Motorola customer service who do not like to solve my issue and the executive was load/rude while addressing my issue. I didn't like customer service at all.
Great phone

Out of the box, super easy to set up.  Updated right away to Cotton Candy.  The phone is very fast surfing the web or switching between applications.  The camera takes great pictures...though the interface for the controls are a bit different from what I am used to with android v4.1 Motorola Atrix HD.  The screen has a beautiful picture.  I was blown away that I played YouTube music videos with Bluetooth headphones for over 30 minutes and only 5% battery was used.  The rapid charger is fantastic.  However, I do wish we could change the volume and sound for Text Notifications vs app notifications.  Overall, good phone, I hope it lasts as long as my Atrix HD 3.5 years.

Love this phone. Great camera, speakers, screen, no carrier bloatware with pure a android experience.  I was worried about the size going from a 5 inch phone to this but have not had the problems that I thought I would have. The battery life is my only issue that I have. Just not as good as my two previous phones (HTC One m9 and Sony Xperia z3). The battery life is not bad just not as good as I am used to.
5.7 quad hd screen, 21 mp 4K camera, metal bezel and buttons, expandable storage, near stock android (marshmallow) and stereo front speakers hard to beat at this price!
Perfect..

You dont have to pick an expensive upgrade to get awesome features. I have found this phone pretty great, its not slow i have a ton of apps and its small enough to fit in my clutch when i don't carry a bag. takes good photos, has an in message capture video button to send video messages easy which is fun for me to use with family. nothing i have tried to use it for has failed yet.

Exactly what I wanted in a phone. I surf the web, text, use my apps and recently (Dec 2015) it updated to Android 6.0. I'm using with AT&T's no contract gophone plan and they simply gave me a new SIM card for free and BAM I was done. I'm ready to roll with this phone when I go on international trips. I read many reviews, rundowns, and comparisons before buying and I think the 2015 Moto X pure edition is one of the best phones for the money. No invite required.
Its a great smartphone.

I pre-ordered this phone directly from the manufacturer.  It was a fine phone, but I dropped it from a height of about 15" one day as I was getting out of the car and overnight it developed a small crack in the upper right corner of the screen that rendered the entire top half of the screen unusable.  I got quoted $150 to replace the screen by a local tech, so i decided to try it out myself and it was such a pain that I gave up.  Avoid this phone!

I am not sure why it doesn't take any SIM card. I put mine (Simple mobile) and my husband's nano SIM card (H2O), and it still showed 'No SIM card'. Then, I switched both SIM cards back to our old ones, it worked fine. The problem is definitely not from the SIM cards.  Not sure if Amazon sent the unlocked one. It looks like the phone is locked. Will have to return this, although I like it very much.

Great phone. Battery life has increased after marshmallow update. Have not been experiencing any issues with the use of this phone. Only thing I noticed is that the edges of the displace are scratched easily.So a case is recommended if you want to prevent that.Having a micro sd card slot is also a blessing.

The device is all right, nothing special. A little heavy. What really really sucks is that it is incredibly fragile. What sucks even more is that Motorola has AWFUL customer service. Service so bad, that it is worth your while to order a more expensive phone from another company. I wanted to get the accident protection plan, since the phone is pathetically fragile. So first, they sign me up for their 1 year extended care, which is not what I asked for. I had them cancel that, so that I could order the correct plan, and they said once you cancel the first plan for a device another can never be added. This company is awful, and I will never again be a customer. Buy foreign. US companies are trash.
Honestly the best phone I've ever had. The feel in the hand from the build quality..  The specs... Camera is pretty good. And for the price I highly recommend this phone.

It took so much to get this phone. I originally had decided on the Nexus 6 because of security concerns with updates not continuing with older phones, and also the budget. I went outside of it because I could take advantage of a credit card (Amazon Store Card).
It's my upgrade from the Moto X 2014, and in every poss way possible.
Really nice phone, sounds really good. Performance is incredible

Its a good phone over all apps run well its solid, fast and sturdy. The cons that most reviewsfail to mencio. Is the camara is pretty bad, quality pictures with very washed out colors, i compared it to most of my friends samsun or iphones and there is no comparison. I mean its a good camara to use for working purposes but no landscapes or artist stuff And the super battery is very week too it doesnt last even 8 hours if youuse your phone a lot, it takes over 3 hours to charge on a normal charger. Ibought this phone cause of its battery supposed to be capacity.good phone to work wirh not so much for leisure.

Hands down the best flagship for this price point. Its great to see consumers no longer have to pay upwards from $650 to get a phone with these spec's. The only other phone to come close is the Oneplus 2, & it lacks NFC, loud Stereo speakers, more than 2 micro phones & an SD card slot. Not to mention this is the only alternative to a nexus if you're looking for a stock android experience, which all android users should. One of the best features of the phone is its size. It's packing a 5.7" display, which is bigger than the iPhone 6 plus, but the Moto X itself is smaller than the iPhone 6 plus. I'm very happy with this purchase.

The good:

Good value for money. It is on the verge of being too big and it is heavy, so if you have smaller hands think it twice before buying.

Camera performance is good enough and I never find myself longing for a better camera phone anymore.

Performance is good, and compared to a Nexus 5X the biggest difference is having 3GB of RAM instead of 2GB. Android is not very efficient with RAM usage apparently, and it is very annoying when Spotify is kicked out when opening Chrome for example. This does not happen with this phone which is great!

I have dropped it 3 times already with no case on and it has held up nicely, like my previous 3 year old moto G.

Fast charging is very fast!

Downsides:

Battery life is no good, but I guess it is bad on all its competitors as well. On a normal day I unplug it at 8AM and it lasts up until 12PM, so it has approximately 16 hs of battery life with my usage. This includes messaging and email, 1 - 2 hs of spotify while training and using social networks while on my daily commute.

The headphone plug has gotten very sensitive with a couple weeks of use and with the slightest pressure it will think that they are unplugged and will pause the music. My 2013 Moto G developed the same problem but on its second year, not on its second week, so Motorola might be doing something wrong with their headphone plugs.
I can't see any real saving from a 16GB to 32GB. Come on $9.00 ???? Sometime I think we are being taken left and right.

The only thing that the MXP does not have is a finger print reader. Other than that, flawless.

Quick and responsive, camera sensor is fine (download other camera apps and your okay), water repellent, speakers are boss, updates are kind, and price is king.

When you start using this phone, you'd question why Motorola didnt raise the price on the MXP.
I love it that's it

It has been an awesome purchase. I've been looking for a great Android phone for almost 2 years and just couldn't something really good. Eventually I bought the Moto X Pure and I'm really happy with it.
I absolutely love the wake up feature. For a mere 2 weeks I'm no longer trying to press the power button to wake a phone. On the negative side, it freaks me out to use any other phone, which doesn't have this feature :)
Nice speakers. It's very convenient to have them on the top. They're pretty loud.
What I'm still have trouble getting used to is the phone size. I'd prefer a bit smaller one to be able to use it with one hand at all times.
The bumper, which comes with the phone is rather slippery. It would be nice to have a bumper, which would provide a firm grip. Haven't found one yet. Any suggestions?

Received one that looked beautiful, worked great on wireless, but the SIM slot was broken, and there was no way to just exchange it for another one through Amazon. And it was one that was, supposedly, checked and guaranteed by Amazon Warehouse Deals, but they didn't check it hard enough.

It was left at Sprint for hours, with them trying to get it setup, only to find the SIM slot was dead on it. Which was a huge bummer - my boyfriend needs to get off of Sprint and I wanted to move him to T-Mobile with me (hence, why we purchased this phone, since it would work on both networks) but it was frustrating to find out that the $300+ I spent on an unlocked phone was wasted, when it was supposed to be guaranteed. I know that's not the easiest thing to check, but you think they would. I can't completely put Amazon Warehouse Deals to blame - apparently the SIM card slot not working was a common defect in these phones. Still, I got my boyfriend's hopes up, only to have them dashed. Had to send it back and get my money back on it.
This phone is perfect. Very snappy, feels great in the hand, and has a pretty good camera. The screen is just flat out amazing. Switched from a note 4 to this phone and love it so so much more!
Everything I wanted in a phone!
Great phone.. So much easier & more intuitive to use my lady loves it

Motorola has died
I have just received the phone
After turning it on, there are dust and lcd burn mark shown in the screen
I am disappointed the quality of Motorola even though I love moto display and action a lot
Its time to say goodbye to Motorola

Moto x pure is a solid phone. Very snappy at normal use. Beautiful screen, perfect size. However battery life and screen quality is kind of hit and miss. My 1st one had a bright pressure spot on the upper left, and battery life is meh (4-5hrs most). 2nd one had a softer bright spot but battery life is a lot better, I can get 5.5 hrs easy. Anyway Amazon return policy is hassle free which makes it worth a shot.
Best phone out
Best phone for the money in the market. Awesome speakers, great screen, more than 1 day battery life, and pure Android. I love it!

OK so I've only had it for 24 hours but dang is this thing fast! Works well on Verizon (required a call to tech support)  also requires a "nano" sim card but a quick trip to the verizon store and ten bucks took care of that.  Great phone.  Music lovers like myself should also order the 64 gig memory card.  Excellent product.

It's really hard to find any true flaws with the Moto X Pure Edition.  The screen is terrific, performance is snappy, the camera performs well, and the front speakers are easily the best in the business.  My only complaint is that the new Lenovo Motorola team is slower to get out software updates.  Previous editions of the Moto X got the latest version of Android as soon as Nexus devices.  Now it seems like they are going to take a few extra months to roll them out.  Otherwise, it's a wonderful device.  The size and weight are nice.  It doesn't feel like a 5.7" device in the hand, but it does when you are watching videos.
Couldn't be happier with this phone. Upgraded from an old nexus 4 and this is the next level. Don't need all the bells and whistles that come on Samsung that cost hundreds more.
Love it! PERIOD!!! And for the Price, best on the Market IMO!

Excellent phone. It runs fast, the fast charge is a charm and it have the best screen phone hand ratio. Though 16 gig of internal storage gets filled quite fast, the camera is not good at night and the screen is not oled.

The bamboo on the back is very nice and a clear side bumper is included. The back is curved making the phone thicker in the middle. After coming from a Samsung galaxy s3, which is 4 years old but still works, I felt the screen on the Moto x looked great but colors were a little less vivid but accurate. Even with the saturation turned on it wasn't as colorful but it is super bright. Fingerprints weren't an issue when using the screen since there must be a coating on it. There is no led notification light and notifications appear on the screen with icons or text. I didn't like this feature since its not very private. You can turn off notifications altogether or pick which app can display notifications. Also my biggest problem was to turn on the display after the screen turned off. It kind of turns on when it wants. I'm still not sure if it's rotation or moving the whole phone that turns it on since it works randomly. You could just use the power button on the side but it's awkward with the bumper on. On the old Samsung you can just hit the home button to turn the screen on and the LG phones you double tap but the Moto X has neither. There is an option where it uses a motion sensor to turn on the screen but that seems like it just wastes the battery.The speakers are great since there are two front facing ones that are loud and create a great stereo effect. The battery in not removable and lasts less then a day even without the SIM card installed but the quick charge works great. On stand by the phone has lasted a week. Setup was easy and Moto has an app transferring contacts and apps from your old phone. There  aren't too many options and customizations you can change since its close to being stock android and I found myself installing Nova launcher right away. Even the pull down menu can't be customized and requires either two fingers or two swipes with one finger to see the entire thing. The camera app was awkward to use as you take a pic by tapping the screen anywhere. The camera app is very basic with not many options besides panorama, selfie and normal mode. You can make the picture brighter by rotating this circle in the middle or focus on different things I'm the shot by moving that circle. You can also turn on and off the shutter sound. Pictures taken were good in good lighting and ok in lower light. It's camera is 21mp so you can zoom in and see a lot of detail. Colors are very accurate. There's not much bloatware that comes with it and the phone is snappy. It's already got the marshmallow update too. But I did find a few times I was using the Internet that instead of scrolling when I slid my finger it would select the word instead on the page as if I was holding my finger still. Not sure if that's a display sensitivity issue or software related. Also 4k videos on you tube would keep stopping but the audio would keep playing. It's nice that it's unlocked and works on many carriers and that you can add an sd card to boost memory. Overall for the price it's a great phone with nice speakers and looks but it doesn't have many options to customize or change settings.
I wish I could be with him ear headphones

I can't write a techie type review. but I can say that this is a nice step up from the Moto G 2nd Generation that I've been using.  It is big, but so nicely designed that it doesn't seem bulky.  It is fast and the display is gorgeous.  I couldn't be happier.
Confiable

Very disappointed that I cannot enable hotspot. Previously used Nexus 5 on Cricket and had no trouble enabling hotspot. Removed sim from Nexus 5 and installed in Moto X. When I tried to enable hotspot it gave me an error saying it could not connect with AT&T server for authentication. I don't have AT&T account so it should not need AT&T authentication. Again, Nexus 5 did not have this problem. Beware, this phone is NOT truly unlocked.

I've had this phone for several months now, and I have been an Android user for a very long time. This is by far the best phone I have ever owned. It takes really great pics, and I have yet to run out of battery life at the end of the day.

Mt favorite feature is that it can be used with any carrier I choose. It connected to Verizon's network without any issues. I also took this phone with me on a trip to Thailand, and swapped out the sim card with a Thai sim card when I arrived. No issues there either.

Every phone should be this easy to use.

Absolutely amazing phone. I am a minority here, but I switched from the iPhone 6 Plus to the MXP. Without boring you, here are the pros & cons:

Pros:
-Screen Quality
-Speakers
- Amazing Pictures in Daylight
- Battery Life (I am a moderate user and I get a day to a day and a half of use)
-Turbo Charging

Cons
- No fingerprint security
- No LED
- Physical capacitive buttons (like the Oneplus One/Two. I know that I'm in the minority here).
- Camera isn't great for low light pictures unless you use flash

Great phone otherwise!
-

this phone turned out to be a huge disappointment.  it's big and heavy like a brick but the worst part is the lack of apps.  motorola left music to google music and email to gmail and finding apps that successfully integrate was impossible.  they just made the hardware and thru android on it and said "there you are" which ends up being a real bug hunt for the user.  camera is good but not good enough to deal with the deficiencies this phone give you including all of the google bloatware that's locked into this phone.  it upgrades to android 6.0 but i didn't find anything worth writing home about there...just more of same ol' same ol' so this phone and what comes with it is just a big pile of crap!  ...and don't look to google for salvation, and don't think that just because the motorola is unbranded sets you free...

The phone was OK for a couple of months, then the touchscreen went haywire, causing the phone to call people randomly on its own. I contacted Motorola for warranty, and they suggested the advanced exchange program where they send a refurbished phone as a replacement instead of waiting for your own phone to be serviced. They were supposed to send it in 4 business days, but it actually took them over a month to do so. When they did, they sent a phone with a factory debug build of Android, completely useless.

It's not a bad phone, but if you have an issue with it, you are pretty much on your own!

So far this phone is great. Some problems with the OS and Moto Voice fighting each other. But I try to ignore that. The sensors are amazing. I never have to press power. Shake to flashlight is awesome and so is twist to camera. Great features someone though of. Voice quality is good, not stellar. Battery life and charge is amazing. I am 4.5 outta 10. No notification light which sucks, unless you 'root' it.hmmm

This phone is fast, I switched over from a Oneplus One and the speed of this blew me away. The display is leaps and bounds better than most phones out there, very crisp and clear.  It has a MicroSD slot which is rare now and days.  The only down side is the battery is not removalable but the charger that is supplied makes up for that, it will charge the phone in less than a hour.  10 mins on the charger and you're close to 50% then it switches to a slow charge to keep from overheating the battery.  Very recommend phone.
Great phone. Love everything about it. Very competitive pricing as well.

I have been using waterproof flip phones for the past 5 years and finally decided to get a smart phone. Now using this moto X on Verizon, activated in store with new nano sim, smooth and no problem. I also used it in China with China Mobile (CMCC) for one month, no problem. The call quality is good, with mainly email and web surfing battery could last about 30 hours. It does get a little bit warm when you make a video call for 30 minutes.
The transparent plastic bumper cover coming in box is not good, catching dirt easily and cracked on the second week. So now I am just using it naked, the rubber back feels nice to hold.

Taking off two stars because A. The camera is just extremely blurry (with HDR / night mode off) unless the lighting is PERFECT. Even on a cloudy day the images come out muddy. The camera app doesn't even bother trying to focus where you point it seems.

Battery is meh, my HTC m8 routinely got 6 hours SoT this phone barely manages 4, probably going to sell it.

Pros: Beautiful display
720p slo mo looks amazing
love the wood back
front speakers beat anything else on the market (including the m9)
near stock experience is smooth

I fell in love with this phone the minute I saw it I was very disappointed to find out that the phone has a glitch and is not compatible with Verizon. I would definitely check with your carrier to make sure this glitch doesn't affect other major networks. By the way, they have must enter a SIM card number in order to find out about the glitch. I also took a star away on the product as Motorola was aware of this problem Sept 2015 and claimed the issue would be fixed in a "couple of days"
Love this phone!

I can't believe all Verizon customers  negatives reviews

If you are a Verizon customer please you need to blame to Verizon ,  not  the phone ... The phone is completely compatible with Verizon the problem  is Verizon that their are refusing to add the emei to their data base for now .. Verizon say need more time to add it ... Probably their are busy thinking how to increase you bill  or how to rise  their prices .  this is the best Android phone ever build since today
Excelent
Excellent
Beautiful phone with a camera that can't be beat.

This happened to be a "Today's Deal" on the morning I dropped my Iphone5S, cracking its screen.  Without much thought and with little research, I bought it.  I am thrilled.  The 5.7" screen is significantly easier for me to read than was the Iphone's 5 inch screen.  I can now easily read email and texts without reading glasses. I find myself using phone features that, though similar versions existed on the Iphone, I had never used because they were too hard to read.  For example, I read news articles off the feed that has learned my interests.  My vision is not particularly poor, but I am middle aged and, uh, size matters.  The 5.7" is perfect.  My hands are average for a man, and I think I'd find a larger phone a bit cumbersome.  This one hits my hand just right.  The processor is so fast that I never think of it; everything pops up instantly.  Battery life is good, and the quick charging feature comes in handy on particularly busy days.  The speakers are so clear and loud that I sometimes listen to music while I shave (I've never done that before with a phone).  I love the simple interface and the absence of bloatware.  I use the simple plastic rim-case that came with the phone, and I purchased 2-year protection directly from Motorola (around 80 bucks, if I remember correctly).  I find it easy to get this phone in and out of my front pockets (my iphone in the otterbox, on the other hand, was hard to move in and out of my pocket).  I added 64GB with an inexpensive sd card that was easy to install.  ;I cannot think of any serious complaint I have.  If I had to make a suggestion, I suppose I'd like to have the power button and volume rocker a bit farther apart -- but that's really picky and it's not really a "problem."  This is, by far, the most I've ever loved a phone.
Fast, good storage, good battery, no issues at all.
My only issue is the battery life and lack of VoIPLTE support

Sprint would not let me activate this phone because I didn't buy it from Sprint.
 I bought this phone to use on Sprint, with the intention of switching to Verizon in a month when my contract with Sprint will be up. I was under the assumption that if you already had a phone with a nano sim card (which this phone requires) you could just put that card into this phone. Sprint won't allow you. Also, none of their stores even had sim cards, so I was required to contact customer service to get one mailed to me. After being transferred 3 times and on the phone for over an hour, they finally told me that it was not possible to activate this phone.
If you buy this phone from Motorola, you can choose to purchase a Sprint sim card. I don't know if it works that way, but its worth a try.

I love Motorola's though. I have a moto x first gen and it still works perfectly. I'm happy with the pure edition, its a nice upgrade without too much extra stuff! Its good size, and doesn't feel uncomfortable in your hand. I was between this and the nexus 5x, and in overall quality, this wins!

Ok so the phone overall is Ok

Pros: Great camera, great sound on both speakers and on ear, very stock android no bloatware, it has a decent battery life with gps and most of moto features turned off, I use it on the T-mobile network and have great reception and call quality.

Cons: battery life with gps and moto features on is terrible I barely last half a day with minimal use. it would be nice to have the same battery life with those features on instead when they are off.
Love this phone.  The bamboo back feels awesome!!!!

I was skeptical at first since I've seen good as well as bad reviews but I'm proud to say it's perfect!! And brand new!! Despite what others have been saying.
Runs smoothly, great sound, amazing camera, calls are great and it's just overall perfect! I have metro PCS and it was a breeze to switch. Honestly all I had to do was get a nano SIM since that's all it takes. The turbo charge works great and I'm glad I bought it! Easy and quick!! Just make sure to get a NANO SIM, a regular SIM won't fit!
so far so good It is a beautiful phone I had no problems putting in the Att sims card and setting it up was easy enough I would recommend for anyone looking for a nice unlocked phone

I'm just coming off of a Verizon serviced LG G2, which I thought was the best phone I've ever owned. This Moto X pure is an improvement.
I've read a lot of cons about battery life but It lasts all day for me and then some, perhaps I'm not as heavy a user as others.

The feature I like best is the double twist to open camera, it has worked flawlessly for me every time.
Has a great screen and that's important because I often use the kindle app for reading books, text is clear and sharp.

The camera takes decent pictures, but I don't like the software interface as much as my prior LG G2.

The phone is rather large to stick in your pocket, but it is workable.  I prefer the bigger screen as I need reading glasses now in this stage of my life.

The best thing about this phone is the price for what you are getting it's far less expensive than the latest iphone or even the LG G4 which is a similarly spec'd phone.  This phone even comes with a clear bumper included with the phone which works very well.

The fast charging is very convenient. I bought the 16gb version and a 64gb SD card which gives me plenty of storage for my pictures and music.

So far I really love this phone. I've had it for about a month. I've only had Motorola smart phones. This one is just so nice. I love the size of the screen. And the bamboo back is just so beautiful The battery life is great. The turbo charger is wonderful. I love the updated OS. Twist of a wrist to turn the phone on is priceless! I use the voice command all the time and it's always spot on.

Overheats wayyyy too much,
Maybe it's just my phone, but my hand sweats when I put the brightness up! It gets up to 114° F all the time!!!
Great deal.  Received brand new and faster than if purchased through the play store.

Spent quite a lot of time looking into the various Android Flagships and narrowed it down between this and the Nexus 6P. Ended up going with the Moto based on the price and extra features on the Moto itself, the track record of the company and build quality. It's been a great purchase for the month I have had it and hope it lasts me a while.

Let me start by saying up until now, I was strictly a Samsung-phyte. This phone is amazing & I'm glad I took a chance on it. It truly gives a "pure" Android experience & is fully customizable without bloatware. I've had this phone for 2 months & I've yet to find something I don't like about it. The charger is awesome, btw, with the phone fully charged in about 1 hour. Battery life depends on connectivity. If i keep on WiFi in areas of low network, battery lasts 8 -10 hrs. High usage will drain battery faster, as to be expected. Awesome phone & audio clarity, and the camera is just amazing. Processing speed is only limited by the network it's connected to. Very pleased & highly recommended!

The best smartphone I have ever used so far. This is the second smartphone that I actually enjoyed ever since the iphone 4(ofcourse there were no other better smartphones in those day). After the iphone4 I bought the iphone 4s for my wife but I know it was also very good smartphone at that time but it did not really enjoy since iOS is so restrictive on what you can do. I also bought the Samsung galaxy S4 for myself and the bloatware was very annoying. I still did not learn my lesson that I bought the Samsung galaxy S6 which I literally slammed it on the floor luckily the floor is carpeted. The Samsung have one of the best cameras out there and they really managed to fail the user experience by adding so much bloatware. I really wanted to slam that as I think of it right now. I think some of us here can relate my frustrations. Until, this Moto X Pure came out. It has a bloatware for sure but it is actually a compliment of what is missing in the OS features. I am referring to the app that Motorola has added "Moto". And that is the only bloatware it has and nothing else. A very essential bloatware that I actually enjoy so much using. Sure the camera is not good compared to other smartphones out there but I don't really use it so much even I had the Samsung S6. But software experience is just so enjoyable. And the FRONT FACING SPEAKERS they so amazingly great. Maybe the Nexus 6p is better like they said but if they dont have an app like the "Moto" I would rather have the Moto X than the Nexus 6p. They really put so much thought on this phone. Thank you Motorola. I am a happy customer.

I am not buying another samsung phone anymore until they get their heads straight ever again.

Very pleased with this phone's performance so far.  Recently received an update from AT&T/Motorola to Android 6 -Marshmallow, I'm still evaluating that.  I immediately added a 32gb Class10,  U3, 4k video capability, microSD card...don't scrimp on that, especially for photo / video storage.
It might be worth it to move up to the 32gb on board memory.  OS and Apps are consuming a little more than I thought.  I currently am using 12.24gb of the 16gb internal memory, as follows
Android OS is 6.39gb,  Internal Stor is 5.85gb of the remaining 9.61gb.  I'm using about 10gb of the 32gb (29.8gb available) added card.  FYI.
Excelent phone!

Pros: large, fast, great camera, great screen, clean user interface, fast updates to Android, people comment positively on the bamboo
Cons: no fingerprint scanner
Amazing phone love it! and works on all carriers!
A big step up from my small screen phone of the past. Good visibility with user friendly menus. It is easy to find what I need. Great phone.
Big, beautiful, smooth, fast, money friendly, perfect!

I received the phone and  went onto motorola website and had questions about the motocare.  i spoke to a rep and they told me the price and it covered me, also they would replace my phone up to 3 times in a year if  I broke it.  It sounded like a great deal so I bought it.  5 days after  Ibought it  I dropped the phone and the screen shattered. Contacted moto and the rep didnt see the coverage.  I gave him my order number and he found it but didnt know why it was not showing, since it was the holidays he thought that might be it...make a long story short dealt with a total  of 6  people who all apologized and said they see i have the protection for damage plan and they didn't know why they couldn't  process the repair.  The last person I spoke to said  the repair is going to be scheduled because  i am covered and to look for the prepaid shipping label within 24 hours. I went 2 days later and saw an email and found out that there was no shipping label but an email from  someone saying i didn't qualify for  my phone to be repaired. s Stating  I didn't have a plan.  I called them and was on the phone for 3 hours and I was told no one can help me.  I am livid that a multi million dollar company doesn't empower its employees to help people.  I was also livid to find out that the first group of people that helped me were level one customer support and they were not allowed to make those decisions.  Long story short the phone has not been fixed.  Worse customer service experience in my life.  Yes it is my fault  I dropped it but if I am being told by multiple people that it can be fied and i have the plan then they should honor thatt.  its not my fault that tier 1 people are not allowed to help customers.
Great phone, top notch. A bargain for the cost.
Great phone can't wait for the '16 version

It's too big. LCD screen in lieu of the LED of previous generations. Two fron-facing speakers are great. It has fewer unique functions and features than previous generations. It has decent features for a fairly inexpensive phone. Always on voice activation seems less effective than the first gen...when it works; it often fails in horrible fashion, such as, "what's up?" is the phrase to tell you the time and give you the option to hear messages. Usually it results in a google search for "What's Up?" or a page showing me what I can do with the phrase "What's up?". It's hearing me, it's just not doing what it's supposed to. Especially problematic when driving.
Probably the last Moto I'll buy. Nothing about it sets it apart from anything else, really. Sure it's pretty much stock Android, which is great, but voice search is less effective than the first gen, there's no longer a chrome extension for the device (they recommend searching for a third party chrome app to text online. Lazy asses), and the stock launcher isn't as flexible as say Nova Launcher, which I'm using. Many of the retired  unique Motorola apps are now built-in to Android. Nothing unique. Merely adequate. Which is OK, but a far cry from the creative engineering I expect from Motorola.
 Moto is just a Lenovo brand, not a company, not a subsidiary; it's the yawn-inducing Lenovo now with a batwing logo. I can't imagine the Lenovo culture won't overrun Motorola's. It's a shame. Motorola had made such a great comeback.
Love it and amazon is awesome as always !!
Recomendado.. Envío en tiempo y forma!

This phone is nearly perfect to me. I would rate 4.5 if possible because of 2 things:
1. Battery life - definitely not the best out there. I usually have to recharge a little at some point because I work long days. The turbo charge ALMOST makes up for this because I usually carry a power brick anyways, but it would be nice to have a battery capacity that I know could make it through a full day of moderate/ heavy use. That is not a big deal though if you always have access to chargers like I do.

2. Camera - This is a very nice camera but I really wish it had OIS. This CAN take beautiful pictures but to get great detail, you have to be pretty still. Also I don't like the default camera app because you cant tap to focus then press a button to take the picture. It's tap to take picture only and sometimes it doesn't focus correctly right away. But, you can always download a different camera app to solve this problem.

Otherwise, I love this phone. It's beautiful, its powerful, and it doesn't break the bank. It almost stock android which is unbelievably smooth if you're coming from carrier phones or phone with an overlapping UI. Motorola puts a few features on it but they are actually super useful and not gimmicky. I would 100% recommend this phone to anyone who needs a phone. I've been using it for 2 weeks and I still get excited about having it.

First phone was defective.  Replacement phone the battery would not keep a proper charge and it was overheating and shutting off the phone.  Very disappointed as Motorola used to produce good products.  Going back to Samsung Galaxy Note
I love this device
Best android for the money today!

So this one is bigger than the 2014 version, but I really like this phone. The battery isn't great, but I was more than prepared for this.
